titles: Good nevves from Virginia Sent to the Counsell and Company of Virginia, resident in England. From Alexander Whitaker, the minister of Henrico in Virginia. Wherein also is a narration of the present state of that countrey, and our colonies there. Perused and published by direction from that Counsell. And a preface prefixed of some matters touching that plantation, very requisite to be made knowne.
author: Whitaker, Alexander, 1585-1617.
Crashaw, William, 1572-1626.
Virginia Company of London.
Counseil for Virginia (England and Wales)
publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston for William Welby, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the Swanne,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Virginia --  Description and travel --  Early works to 1800.
Virginia --  History --  Colonial period, ca. 1600-1775 --  Early works to 1800.
